annotation.spannedText: Hepatitis B vaccine is a vaccine that prevents hepatitis B

classMention.mentionClass: Hepatitis B vaccine is a vaccine that prevents hepatitis B

annotation.spannedText: Serious side effects from the hepatitis B vaccine are very uncommon

classMention.mentionClass: Serious side effects from the hepatitis B vaccine are very uncommon

annotation.spannedText: It is safe for use during pregnancy or while breastfeeding

classMention.mentionClass: It is safe for use during pregnancy or while breastfeeding

annotation.spannedText: In countries with high rates of hepatitis B infection, vaccination of newborns has not only reduced the risk of infection, but has also led to marked reduction in liver cancer

classMention.mentionClass: In countries with high rates of hepatitis B infection, vaccination of newborns has not only reduced the risk of infection, but has also led to marked reduction in liver cancer

annotation.spannedText: these people should receive a single booster vaccination at this time, but do not need further retesting

classMention.mentionClass: these people should receive a single booster vaccination at this time, but do not need further retesting

annotation.spannedText: People who fail to respond (anti-Hbs antibody level below 10 mIU/ml) should be tested to exclude current or past Hepatitis B infection, and given a repeat course of 3 vaccinations, followed by further retesting 1–4 months after the second course

classMention.mentionClass: People who fail to respond (anti-Hbs antibody level below 10 mIU/ml) should be tested to exclude current or past Hepatitis B infection, and given a repeat course of 3 vaccinations, followed by further retesting 1–4 months after the second course

annotation.spannedText: It is now believed that the hepatitis B vaccine provides indefinite protection

classMention.mentionClass: It is now believed that the hepatitis B vaccine provides indefinite protection

annotation.spannedText: it was previously believed and suggested that the vaccination would only provide effective cover of between five and seven years

classMention.mentionClass: it was previously believed and suggested that the vaccination would only provide effective cover of between five and seven years

annotation.spannedText: subsequently it has been appreciated that long-term immunity derives from immunological memory which outlasts the loss of antibody levels and hence subsequent testing and administration of booster doses is not required in successfully vaccinated immunocompetent individuals

classMention.mentionClass: subsequently it has been appreciated that long-term immunity derives from immunological memory which outlasts the loss of antibody levels and hence subsequent testing and administration of booster doses is not required in successfully vaccinated immunocompetent individuals

annotation.spannedText: for initial responders who require ongoing protection, such as for healthcare workers, only a single booster is advocated at 5 years

classMention.mentionClass: for initial responders who require ongoing protection, such as for healthcare workers, only a single booster is advocated at 5 years
